communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Confined Disposal Facility Application
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request a copy of the following documents:

A. The application submitted by the Corps to the Illinois Environmental Protection Agency on March 19, 2021, regarding the renewal and modification of the Water Pollution Control Permit No. 2016-EO-60898, pertaining to the Corps’ operation of the existing Confined Disposal Facility ("CDF"). 

B. The request submitted to the Illinois Environmental Protection Agency on March 1, 2023, for certification under Section 401 of the Clean Water Act related to its proposed vertical expansion of the Confined Disposal Facility.

C. The letter received by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers sent from the Illinois Environmental Protection agency on April 6, 2023, which requested additional information to the former request. 

D. The letter detailing the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers' withdrawal of its request, sent to the Illinois Environmental Protection Agency on January 24, 2024. 

I have attached to this request a letter from the IEPA Acting Director sent to the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, which details the existence of these documents (second page, first paragraph).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Britton Struthers-Lugo

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Calumet Dredged Material Disposal Facility
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails, inclusive of attachments, between the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers and the Illinois Environmental Protection Agency relating to the "Calumet Dredged Material Disposal Facility" (“DMDF”) and the  "Confined Disposal Facility" (“CDF”) from July 11, 2024 through present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Britton Struthers-Lugo

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Raffle
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello,

I am requesting records related to the department’s fundraising for Baker to Vegas and a gun raffle. Limited search to 2024 to today

Communications:
- emails 
- attachments 

Venmo/Zelle receipts and records of money donations for the raffle. Purchase orders, records of donation, legal paperwork required of handgun. Spreadsheets or other data collected that tracks all donations  , expenses, and purchases related to the Baker/Las Vegas run.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott
